alert.note: Alert for Latah (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 01 at 9:06PM MST until March 02 at 10:34PM MST by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Idaho... St Joe River at St Maries affecting Benewah County. ...The Flood Watch continues for the following rivers in Washington...Idaho... Palouse River near Potlatch affecting Latah and Whitman Counties. .Steady rains will move back into North Idaho and Southeastern Washington overnight and continue on and off through Thursday. Rainfall amounts over the next 48 hours could be upwards of an inch. Mild temperatures and ripening midlevel snowpack will contribute runoff into the river basins. For the Palouse River...including Potlatch...flooding is possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Palouse River near Potlatch. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon to Thursday evening. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Extensive flooding of the low lying areas between Potlatch, ID and Palouse, WA will occur. Flooding will occur at the Lions Club Community Park and Hayton Greene Park in Palouse. South River Road will likely be flooded where it crosses the Palouse River at Wellesley Rd. The Potlatch softball and baseball fields will start to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 12.9 feet. - Sharp rises were observed Monday night into Tuesday afternoon. Rises have slowed over the last 2-3 hours and are expected to remain steady overnight before increasing again Wednesday as steady rains return. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.Wednesday morning at 1000 AM PST.
